revised_title: Iodo-Organic Compound Synthesis: Chloride of Iodine Reactions with Organic Bodies
tldr: The author conducted experiments with chloride of iodine and various organic bodies, such as iodide of allyle and bromide of aldehydene. They discovered that chloride of iodine directly combines with these organic radicals, forming new iodo-organic compounds. These compounds are colorless oils with a sweet and biting taste, and they are insoluble in water. The reactions involve addition and double decomposition processes.
